refnamediv.refpurpose: various utilities functions to manipulate uris

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_format_file_size_for_display ()
refsect2.para: Formats the file size passed in bytes in a way that is easy for the user to read. Gives the size in bytes, kilobytes, megabytes or gigabytes, choosing whatever is appropriate.

listitem.simpara: a newly allocated string with the size ready to be shown.

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_escape_string ()
refsect2.para: Escapes string, replacing any and all special characters with equivalent escape sequences.

listitem.simpara: string to be escaped
a newly allocated string equivalent to string but with all special characters escaped

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_escape_path_string ()
refsect2.para: Escapes path, replacing only special characters that would not be found in paths (so '/', '&', '=', and '?' will not be escaped by this function).

listitem.simpara: string to be escaped
a newly allocated string equivalent to path but with non-path characters escaped

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_escape_host_and_path_string ()
refsect2.para: Escapes path, replacing only special characters that would not be found in paths or host name (so '/', '&', '=', ':', '@' and '?' will not be escaped by this function).

listitem.simpara: string to be escaped
a newly allocated string equivalent to path but with non-path/host characters escaped

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_escape_slashes ()
refsect2.para: Escapes only '/' and '%' characters in string, replacing them with their escape sequence equivalents.

listitem.simpara: string to be escaped
a newly allocated string equivalent to string, but with no unescaped '/' or '%' characters

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_unescape_string ()
refsect2.para: Decodes escaped characters (i.e. PERCENTxx sequences) in escaped_string. Characters are encoded in PERCENTxy form, where xy is the ASCII hex code for character 16x+y.

listitem.simpara: an escaped URI, path, or other string
a string containing a sequence of characters considered "illegal", '\0' is automatically in this list.
a newly allocated string with the unescaped equivalents, or NULL if escaped_string contained one of the characters in illegal_characters.

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_make_uri_canonical ()
refsect2.para: Standarizes the format of the uri being passed, so that it can be used later in other functions that expect a canonical URI.

listitem.simpara: and absolute or relative URI, it might have scheme.
a newly allocated string that contains the canonical representation of uri.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_make_path_name_canonical ()
refsect2.para: Calls _gnome_vfs_canonicalize_pathname, allocating storage for the result and providing for a cleaner memory management.

listitem.simpara: a file path, relative or absolute
a canonical version of path

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_make_uri_from_input ()
refsect2.para: Takes a user input path/URI and makes a valid URI out of it.
This function is the reverse of gnome_vfs_format_uri_for_display but it also handles the fact that the user could have typed arbitrary UTF8 in the entry showing the string.

listitem.simpara: a possibly mangled "uri", in UTF8
a newly allocated uri.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_make_uri_from_input_with_dirs ()
refsect2.para: Determines a fully qualified URL from a relative or absolute input path. Basically calls gnome_vfs_make_uri_from_input except it specifically tries to support paths relative to the specified directories (can be homedir and/or current directory).

listitem.simpara: a relative or absolute path
directory to use as a base directory if uri is a relative path.
a newly allocated string containing the fully qualified URL

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_make_uri_from_shell_arg ()
refsect2.para: Similar to gnome_vfs_make_uri_from_input, except that:
1) guesses relative paths instead of http domains 2) doesn't bother stripping leading/trailing white space 3) doesn't bother with ~ expansion--that's done by the shell

listitem.simpara: a possibly mangled "uri"
a newly allocated uri

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_make_uri_full_from_relative ()
refsect2.para: Returns a full URI given a full base URI, and a secondary URI which may be relative.
This function is deprecated, please use gnome_vfs_uri_make_full_from_relative from gnome-vfs-uri.h

listitem.simpara: uri to use as the base for the full uri
full or relative path to append to the base uri
the URI (NULL for some bad errors).

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_expand_initial_tilde ()
refsect2.para: If path starts with a ~, representing the user's home directory, expand it to the actual path location.

listitem.simpara: a local file path which may start with a '~'
a newly allocated string with the initial tilde (if there was one) converted to an actual path

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_get_local_path_from_uri ()
refsect2.para: Create a local path for a file:/// URI. Do not use with URIs of other methods.

listitem.simpara: URI to convert to a local path
a newly allocated string containing the local path NULL is returned on error or if the uri isn't a file: URI without a fragment identifier (or chained URI).

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_get_uri_from_local_path ()
refsect2.para: Returns a file:/// URI for the local path local_full_path.

listitem.simpara: a full local filesystem path (i.e. not relative)
a newly allocated string containing the URI corresponding to local_full_path (NULL for some bad errors).

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_is_executable_command_string ()
refsect2.para: Checks if command_string starts with the full path of an executable file or an executable in $PATH.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if command_string started with and executable file, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_list_deep_free ()
refsect2.para: Free list, and call g_free() on all data members.

listitem.simpara: list to be freed

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_get_volume_free_space ()
refsect2.para: Stores in size the amount of free space on a volume. This only works for URIs with the file: scheme.

listitem.simpara: GNOME_VFS_OK on success, otherwise an error code

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_is_primary_thread ()
refsect2.para: Check if the current thread is the thread with the main glib event loop.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the current thread is the thread with the main glib event loop

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_get_uri_scheme ()
refsect2.para: Retrieve the scheme used in uri

listitem.simpara: a stringified URI
A newly allocated string containing the scheme, NULL if uri it doesn't seem to contain a scheme

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_uris_match ()
refsect2.para: Compare two URIs.

listitem.simpara: stringified URI to compare with uri_2.
stringified URI to compare with uri_1.
TRUE if they are the same, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: GNOME_VFS_ASSERT_PRIMARY_THREAD
refsect2.para: Asserts that the current thread is the thread with the main glib event loop

refsect2.title: GNOME_VFS_ASSERT_SECONDARY_THREAD
refsect2.para: Asserts that the current thread is NOT the thread with the main glib event loop

refsect2.title: gnome_vfs_read_entire_file ()
refsect2.para: Reads an entire file into memory for convenience. Beware accidentally loading large files into memory with this function.

listitem.simpara: URI of the file to read
after reading the file, contains the size of the file read
contains the file_size bytes, the contents of the file at uri.
An integer representing the result of the operation

refsect2.para: Since 2.2
